business.headline: Sensex, Nifty erase gains to close flat amid tariff uncertainty; Zomato down 6%The S&P BSE Sensex closed just 32.81 points above at 78,017.19 after having gained nearly 700 points in the day. Nifty also followed a similar pattern as it ended with just a 10.30 point gain at 23,668.65.

Air India staff to fly economy as airline tackles passenger concerns: ReportThe move is part of Air India's effort to improve its service and customer experience, following criticism over frequent flight delays.

India open to tariff cuts on US imports worth $23 billion: ReportThe government is trying to reduce the impact of US President Donald Trump's global reciprocal tariffs, which are set to take effect from April 2.
What is Google tax that India is likely to scrap from April 1?The tax is expected to be scrapped from April 1, 2025, as part of amendments to the Finance Bill.

Sensex down over 700 points from day's high. Why stock market turned volatile?Stock market today: At around 11:45 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 51.05 points to 77,933.33 and the NSE Nifty50 declined 17.85 points to trade at 23,640.50.

India likely to remove 6% Google tax from April 1, tech giants to benefitThe Equalisation Levy know as 'Google Tax' was introduced in 2016 to tax payments made by Indian businesses to foreign companies for digital advertising services.

UltraTech Cement shares surge 4% in early trade today. Here's whyGlobal brokerage firm UBS has shared a fresh view on India's cement sector and upgraded stocks such as UltraTech Cement and Ambuja Cement.
Sensex jumps 700 points in early trade. 5 key things to know todayThe S&P BSE was up 739.51 points to 78,723.89 at 10.01 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 196 points to 23,854.35.

TCS, HCLTech, Infosys, Wipro: Why IT stocks are rising todayShares of IT major Infosys jumped over 2%, while Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) shares were trading over 1.5% higher on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). HCLTech shares were also up over 2% and Wipro shares rose over 1.3%.

Sensex, Nifty open in green as FIIs return on Dalal Street; IT stocks gainStock market opening on March 25: The S&P BSE Sensex gained over 350 points higher to open over 78,000, while the NSE Nifty50 gained nearly 100 points to trade above 23,750.

Sensex, Nifty set to extend rally: Key sectors to watch, strategies and risksStock market today: For those looking to invest, selective stock picking is key. With Nifty50 trading below its long-term valuation averages, investors may find value in largecap and midcap stocks.
Ola Electric shares to be in focus today. Here's whyIn an early morning exchange filing, Ola Electric Technologies announced that it has "amicably settled all outstanding dues" with Rosmerta Group.

entertainment.headline: Sonu Sood's wife injured in car accident, actor shares updateActor Sonu Sood's wife, Sonali, sustained injuries during a road accident on the Mumbai-Nagpur highway.  The actor updated about his wife's condition and said that she is 'doing fine now.'

Adolescence is being slammed for race-swapping. Here's the factRarely has an OTT series created the kind of reaction worldwide as Adolescence, a limited series by Netflix. British PM Keir Starmer has said it should be screened in schools. However, amid the praise from all around, Adolescence has been accused of race-swapping. What is the fact, and does it really matter in this case?

Actor Elisabeth Olsen reveals if she is going to return to MCU for Avengers filmsHollywood star Elisabeth Olsen discloses if she is going to make a return to the Marvel Cinematic Universe for the upcoming Marvel films, Avengers: Doomsday and Avengers: Secret Wars.

Hansal Mehta asks if Kangana faced vandalism, actor calls him 'stupid' in responseKangana Ranaut criticised Hansal Mehta for his alleged selective silence over the demolition of her office in Mumbai, calling him "bitter and stupid". She also asked the director, with whom she collaborated with in Simran, to stay out of her matters.

I'm shattered: Pawan Kalyan remembers karate coach Shihan HussainiActor and Deputy Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh, Pawan Kalyan, paid an emotional tribute to actor and karate coach Shihan Hussaini. He died at a private hospital in Chennai on March 25 after battling blood cancer.

Actor Jugal Hansraj condemns personal attacks on Ibrahim, KhushiActor Jugal Hansraj criticises the harsh trolling of newcomers Khushi Kapoor and Ibrahim Ali Khan following their film 'Nadaaniyan', highlighting the negative impact of social media's instant criticism culture.

Singer Miley Cyrus announces new album Something Beautiful, shares artworkPop star Miley Cyrus has announced her upcoming album Something Beautiful. She shared a stunning artwork for the album along with a note about the project.

Farah Khan shares glimpse of Anil Kapoor's wife Sunita's grand midnight bashDirector Farah Khan shared a glimpse of Anil Kapoor's wife Sunita's midnight birthday celebrations. The star-studded guest list feature Chunky Pandey, Bhavana Pandey, Maheep Kapoor and others.

Chhorii 2 teaser: It is Nushrratt Bharuccha vs supernatural forces once againThe first promo of Nushrratt Bharuccha-starrer horror-thriller Chhorii 2 is here, and it promises a lot of thrills and chills for the fans of the horror genre.

Who's the real Sikandar? Aamir Khan-Salman Khan throw a curveball at AR MurugadossSalman Khan and Aamir Khan shared the teaser of their promotional video, also featuring Sikandar director AR Murugadoss. Check out the interesting video inside.

After Anirudh, composer Thaman to perform ahead of SRH vs LSG match in HyderabadComposer Thaman will be performing ahead of the SunRisers Hyderabad vs Lucknow Super Giants match in the ongoing Indian Premier League (IPL). He will be performing his hit numbers from Guntur Kaaram and other films.

Prithviraj Sukumaran shares update on Empuraan 3, confirms work has begunActor and director Prithviraj Sukumaran talked about the third part of 'Empuraan'. He spoke at a film event in Chennai and shared that the work on the third part has already begun.

Kalki Koechlin on producer's filler suggestion: I wanted to stab him with my forkIn a recent interview, actor Kalki Koechlin recalled a producer who suggested cosmetic fillers. She expressed her resolve to embrace her natural appearance despite such pressures.

Pawan Kalyan shares why he is not going to quit films anytime soonActor-politician Pawan Kalyan has no intention to quit movies anytime soon. The Deputy Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh shared that he doesn't want to quit acting for more reasons than one.

Actor Aasif Sheikh shares health update: I was brought to Mumbai in a wheelchairActor Aasif Sheikh shared his health update after reports of him collapsing on shooting sets emerged online. The actor stated that his sciatica pain worsened the situation.

Kunal Kamra case different, demolition of my home was illegal: Kangana RanautKangana Ranaut was referring to the demolition of her property in Pali Hill, Bandra, in September 2020, by the BMC on grounds of unauthorised construction.
Sunny Deol urges Bollywood to learn cinema from South: I shall go and settle thereActor Sunny Deol urged Bollywood producers to learn cinema from the South. He even hinted about settling there.

No cuts in Salman Khan's Sikandar, but changes in political scenes. Check run time'Sikandar' has been passed by the censor board without any cuts. The Salman Khan starrer is shorter than most of his other theatrical releases. Scroll down for details.

Rapper Travis Scott to make India debut with 'Circus Maximus World Tour' in DelhiAmerican rapper and singer-songwriter Travis Scott is set to make his India debut with the Circus Maximus World Tour. Scott will perform in New Delhi on October 18, 2025.

general news.headline: Kunal Kamra takes on Shiv Sena with new song after Mumbai studio vandalismKunal Kamra shared a video with a new melody to slam Sena workers for vandalising Mumbai's Habitat comedy club where he had mocked Eknath Shinde.

Top commander with Rs 25 lakh bounty among three Naxalites killed in ChhattisgarhThe gunfight broke out around 8 am in a forest along the border of Dantewada and Bijapur districts of Chhattisgarh when a team of security personnel was out on an anti-Naxalite operation.

Disha Salian death: Aaditya Thackeray, ex-top cop, others named in complaintThe lawyer of Disha Salian's father has filed a case with the Mumbai Police, accusing Aaditya Thackeray, a former top cop, and others in his complaint.

India open to tariff cuts on US imports worth $23 billion: ReportThe government is trying to reduce the impact of US President Donald Trump's global reciprocal tariffs, which are set to take effect from April 2.

British PM Keir Starmer has said it should be screened in schools. However, amid the praise from all around, Adolescence has been accused of race-swapping. What is the fact, and does it really matter in this case?

Kunal Kamra seeks week's time to appear before cops in Eknath Shinde joke rowKunal Kamra, who referred to Eknath Shinde as a 'traitor' in a Bollywood parody song, was asked to appear before the investigating officer on Tuesday.

Mohammed Siraj opens up on Champions Trophy snub: Couldn't digest it at firstMohammed Siraj opened up on his snub from India's Champions Trophy squad and revealed how he used the break he got. Siraj was a non-travelling reserve for the Champions Trophy.

Who is Jeffrey Goldberg: Journalist mistakenly added to US's secret war plan chatThe accidental inclusion of Jeffrey Goldberg in a high-level Pentagon chat group where top officials of the Trump administration discussed classified plans for strikes against Houthi rebels exposed alarming lapses in operational security.

Called me names like h****khor: Kangana Ranaut vs Hansal Mehta over demolitionKangana Ranaut criticised Hansal Mehta for his alleged selective silence over the demolition of her office in Mumbai, calling him "bitter and stupid". She also asked the director, with whom she collaborated with in Simran, to stay out of her matters.

Meerut rerun: UP woman kills husband with help of lover, contract killerThe woman, identified as Pragati Yadav, with the help of her lover and a contract killer, plotted murder of her husband in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri district, just two weeks after their marriage.

Sonu Sood's wife injured in car accident, actor shares updateActor Sonu Sood's wife, Sonali, sustained injuries during a road accident on the Mumbai-Nagpur highway.  The actor updated about his wife's condition and said that she is 'doing fine now.'

Action causes reaction: Eknath Shinde on Sena's rampage over Kunal Kamra jokeEknath Shinde's remarks came amid the ongoing controversy over stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra's latest video where he called the Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister a 'gaddar' (traitor) for his 2022 rebellion against Uddhav Thackeray.

Has Trump triggered US brain drain, the biggest since World War II?The US might witness an exodus of researchers, if media reports and chatter on social media are anything to go by. The flight of scientists might be the biggest since scientists fled Nazi Germany. With President Donald Trump slashing research funding and increasing work visa scrutiny, European countries are planning to seize on the brain drain from the US.

Cash row: Court panel to probe judge's call records, events on night of recoveryThe Supreme Court-appointed in-house panel started its inquiry into allegations of cash discovery at the residence of Justice Yashwant Varma.

Coup in Bangladesh against Yunus? Army holds emergency meetingSince Muhammad Yunus took charge last year, there has been growing unrest and mistrust among the people in Bangladesh towards the government.

Bengaluru woman spikes husband's food with mother's help, kills him laterThe Bengaluru police arrested a realtor's wife and mother-in-law for his murder. Investigators say they spiked his food with sleeping pills, lured him to a secluded spot, and slit his throat.

Did Rana Sanga invite Babur to invade India, sow seeds of Mughal rule?Samajwadi Party MP Ramji Lal Suman called Rajput ruler Rana Sanga a "traitor" in Parliament, claiming he invited Babur to "invade India". The remark sparked a massive controversy and reignited a long-standing debate. Did Rana Sanga invite Babur to India? Here's what historians and historical records say.

Yogi Adityanath on Kunal Kamra row: Treated freedom of speech as birthrightYogi Adityanath, in an interview with ANI, touched upon a range of hot-button topics, from the crackdown on criminals in the state to alleged foreign interference in elections.

Video: Boxer Saweety Boora assaults husband Deepak Hooda inside police stationIn a video that has gone viral, boxer Saweety Boora has been seen assaulting Kabaddi player Deepak Niwas Hooda inside a police station in Hisar, Haryana. The incident took place on March 15.

Andhra man found dead in Texas a day after going missing, police suspect suicideA man from Andhra Pradesh's Krishna district was found dead in Texas a day after he went missing. Authorities suspect suicide, while his family raises funds to bring his body home.

RG Kar rape victim sought help a month before death, faced bias: DoctorA psychiatrist claimed the RG Kar rape-murder victim faced extreme mental stress due to long duty hours, discrimination, and hospital irregularities.

Delhi BJP MLAs demand closure of meat shops during Navratri, Congress MP backs callBJP leaders in Delhi and J&K have demanded the closure of meat shops during Navratri, citing Hindu sentiments, a move backed by Congress MP Imran Masood.

MS Dhoni defends Impact Player rule: High scores happening due to teams' mindsetLegendary Chennai Super Kings (CSK) wicketkeeper batter MS Dhoni shared his thoughts on the Impact Player Rule of the Indian Premier League and said that it's not solely responsible for the repeated high scores being seen in the tournament.

Jackson Wang teases second song GBAD from Magic Man 2 ahead of India visitJackson Wang teases fans with his upcoming single GBAD, part of the much-anticipated album Magic Man 2. Known for his experimental style, Wang is also set to collaborate with an Indian artist, strengthening his connection with India.

sports.headline: Pitch invader reveals what Virat Kohli told him after he touched his feet in KolkataThe pitch invader who breached security to meet Virat Kohli during the opening game of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) opened up on his interaction with the star batter.

IPL 2025: Rishabh Pant's poor start as LSG skipper played down by Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar has backed Rishabh Pant to bounce back from his poor first outing as captain of the Lucknow Super Giants team. LSG were beaten by DC in Vizag on Monday, March 24.

Ashutosh Sharma credits Kevin Pietersen's advices for thrilling run chase vs LucknowDelhi Capitals batter Ashutosh Sharma credited head coach Kevin Pietersen's advices following his match-winning innings against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in Match 4 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Iconic Gabba to be demolished after 2032 Olympics, Brisbane to get new stadiumThe iconic Gabba is all set to be demolished after the 2032 Olympics with Brisbane all set to get a new stadium. The new venue is set to be a 60,000-seater stadium.

GT vs PBKS Playing XI Prediction, IPL 2025: Shreyas Iyer's Punjab ready for new eraGujarat Titans and Punjab Kings are all set to lock horns in Mach 4 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) at the Narendra Modi Stadium, Ahmedabad. Both teams will be eager to get their campaign off to a winning start.

In Punjab Kings' new dawn, young Suryansh Shedge looks to make a mark in IPLPunjab Kings have bought a host of young Indian talent for IPL 2025, with Suryansh Shedge right at the thick of things. An ardent fan of Virat Kohli, the all-rounder told India Today in an exclusive interaction about his finishing skills, IPL 2025 goals and more.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
